title: messageBox

Depending on the button selected by the user, further algorithm actions can be set. Syntax messageBox (style, text, level, [header], buttons) Setting Purpose style Select the formatting style, the settings of which will be applied to the text message area of the dialog box. The selection is made using drop-down list of pre-created styles. To create a new formatting style, click on the action menu on the right side of the field and select the "Add" option in the context menu. text Text of the message that will be displayed in the dialog box. The parameter supports text formatting with the following tags: – the text enclosed within these tags will appear in bold;
– the text following this tag will start on a new line. level Message level selection using drop-down list from "Message level directory" type objects [SYS_DIR_MSG_LEVEL]. Depending on the selected value, the corresponding icon will be added to the left part of the text message area. Possible options: Information – ; Attentional – ; Error – . header Title of the dialog box. Optional parameter. buttons Selection buttons. The selection is made by checking the checkboxes available in the drop-down list. Possible options - "Button directory" type objects [SYS_DIR_BUTTONS]: "Yes"; "No"; "OK"; "Cancel" is the button to close the dialog box. Note The function is called using the button located in the algorithm editor on the "Advanced" tab. As a result, a modal window opens, in which the settings of the dialog box are specified: After clicking on the "Done" button, the construction of the messageBox function with the selected parameters will be added to the algorithm code. If necessary, the formatting style, the message level and the set of buttons can be changed using the dict function, followed by the selection of the appropriate object type . The enumeration of all parameters is separated by commas. The size of the dialog box is set via the formatting style using the "Style" parameter located in the "System" block. For example, to set the size of the dialog box to 400x200 px, the width and height are set as follows: By default, the size of the dialog box is 800x400 px. A dialog non-modal window displayed by the messageBox function will appear on all user browser tabs until one of its buttons is clicked. Use cases Use case 1 Suppose a user needs to display a dialog window offering to receive the current price list at the email address provided during registration. If the user agrees, a message with the price list should be sent to the email address. In case of refusal, the system will show a notification about the possibility of obtaining this information from the manager. To achieve this, in the algorithm editor, the messageBox function should be called, and the following parameters should be specified in the modal window: As results, the algorithm code will include the construction: The messageBox function returns a value selected by user (clicking the "Yes" / "No" / "Cancel" button). Depending on the result obtained, the necessary actions are configured. The algorithm code may take the following form: Other functions used to write this algorithm The result of the function execution is written to the res variable ; Conditions for comparing the value obtained by the messageBox function (res variable) with the corresponding element of the "Buttons directory" (added through the dict function) are set using the if function; Selecting a directory item. Sending a message is implemented using the sendMsgToEmail function; To display notification, use the sendPopupMsg function. The parameter header and text can be supplemented with user data by specifying the corresponding basic object type, after which the necessary attributes can be inserted using the attr function, for example, full name and email address. As results of executing the algorithm and clicking "No", a dialog window of the following type is displayed: After clicking "No", the user will get the following popup notification: When clicking the button: "Yes" - the user will receive an email to the specified address; "No" - a popup notification will be displayed; "Cancel" (cross) - the dialog window will be closed with no additional actions.
